Overview:
       

Asset management is the art of balancing performance, cost, and risk. Achieving this balance requires the alignment of corporate goals, management decisions, and technical decisions. It also requires the corporate culture, business processes, and information systems capable of making rigorous and consistent spending decisions based on asset-level data. This two day course provides the management, engineering, and IT skills essential for successful T&D asset management.
WHO SHOULD ATTEND THIS COURSE:
This is a perfect course for companies considering asset management strategies and for existing asset management companies looking to achieve the next level of performance. This course is ideal for T&D planners, engineers, managers, and executives..
WHAT ATTENDEES WILL LEARN:
This course covers all topics that are critical for T&D companies transitioning from an functional organization to an asset management organization:
Framework: Goals, Functions, Processes
          Competencies: Management, Engineering, Information
          Asset Planning: Project Evaluation, Portfolio Selection
          Risk Management: Financial Risk, Physical Risk
          Key Issues: Aging Infrastructure, Reliability, Utilization
